user.title: Smart Climate Control Setup - Checking Configuration
user.description:
Checking your Home Assistant configuration...

The wizard will automatically configure packages support if needed.

packages_added.title: ‚úÖ Packages Configuration Added
packages_added.description:
**Packages support has been added to your configuration.yaml!**

The following line was added:
```yaml
homeassistant:
  packages: !include_dir_named packages
```

**Next Step:** Please restart Home Assistant, then run this wizard again to create your climate control setup.

room_name.title: Smart Climate Control Setup (Step 1 of 5)
room_name.description:
Welcome to the Smart Climate Control Setup Wizard!

This wizard will guide you through creating a complete climate control automation for your room.

**What will be created:**
‚Ä¢ Helper entities for tracking and automation
‚Ä¢ Complete blueprint automation
‚Ä¢ Fully configured climate control system

**Let's get started!**

Enter the room name you want to control:

data.room_name: Room Name (e.g., Living Room, Bedroom, Office)

features.title: Select Features (Step 2 of 5)
features.description:
Choose which features to enable for **{room_name}**.

**All features are recommended for best performance!**

These determine which helper entities will be created and which automation features will be available.

data.enable_manual_override: ‚úÖ Manual Override Detection (detects manual AC changes)
data.enable_smart_mode: ‚úÖ Smart Mode (presence detection and timeout logic)

climate_entities.title: Select Climate Entities (Step 3 of 5)
climate_entities.description:
Select the A/C unit(s) for **{room_name}**.

You can select multiple A/C units if your room has more than one.

**Tip:** If you don't see your A/C, make sure it's properly integrated in Home Assistant first.

sensors.title: Select Sensors (Step 4 of 5)
sensors.description:
Configure optional sensors for **{room_name}**.

**All sensors are optional but recommended for best accuracy!**

**Temperature Sensor:** External thermometer for more accurate readings

**Room Presence Sensors:** Add your BLE sensors (e.g., sensor.phone_ble_area), motion sensors (PIR), mmWave sensors, or any occupancy detection sensors.

**üõèÔ∏è For Bedrooms:** Include bed occupancy sensors (e.g., binary_sensor.bed_occupancy) for sleep detection! You can select multiple sensors for better accuracy.

data.room_presence_sensors: Room Presence Sensors - BLE, Motion, mmWave, Bed Sensor, etc. (optional, multiple)

bedroom_mode.title: Bedroom Configuration (Step 4.5 of 5)
bedroom_mode.description:
Is **{room_name}** a bedroom with a bed occupancy sensor?

**üõèÔ∏è BEDROOM Mode Benefits:**
‚Ä¢ Detects presence when sleeping (bed sensor)
‚Ä¢ Detects presence when awake (motion sensor)
‚Ä¢ Prevents false positives (phone left behind)
‚Ä¢ Works with any sensor combination

**Select YES if:**
‚Ä¢ This is a bedroom
‚Ä¢ You added a bed occupancy sensor above
‚Ä¢ You want the AC to stay on while sleeping

**Select NO for:**
‚Ä¢ Living rooms, offices, other areas
‚Ä¢ Bedrooms without bed sensors

temperature.title: Temperature Settings (Step 5 of 5)
temperature.description:
Configure basic temperature settings for **{room_name}**.

**Almost there!** Click Submit to create everything.

**What happens next:**
1. All helper entities will be created automatically
2. Your blueprint automation will be configured
3. Climate control will be ready to use immediately!

error.create_failed: Failed to create helper entities. Check logs for details.
error.creation_failed: Failed to create climate control setup. Check logs for details.
error.no_climate_entities: Please select at least one A/C unit.
error.climate_entities_in_use:
‚ö†Ô∏è One or more of these A/C units are already being controlled by another room's automation. Each A/C unit can only be controlled by one automation at a time.

Already in use by: {conflicting_rooms}

Please either:
‚Ä¢ Select different A/C units
‚Ä¢ Delete the conflicting room's setup first

abort.no_climate_entities: No climate entities found in Home Assistant. Please add A/C integrations first.

init.title: Options
init.description:
**Note:** Changing these options will NOT automatically create or delete helpers or modify the automation.

To update your setup, you'll need to:
1. Manually create/delete helpers as needed
2. Update the automation configuration

This is mainly for tracking which features you enabled.
